KEEP YOUR EYE ON THE PRIZE

Share on Facebook Share
Share on TwitterTweet
Share on Google Plus Share
Share on LinkedIn Share

In advertising sales we are always working to deadlines, be it a print deadline, a simple campaign or an annual target; it is always important to remain focused and keep your eye on the prize. Personally I always have all my prospects up on a big board with the names of the potential advertisers and the $ amount along side; as each deal is closed I use a thick red marker and write “booked”, plus I make a tick alongside the advertiser. At the top of the board I have the revenue target and alongside a running total of sales paid to date. I am 100% focused on reaching that target, if I start to see some crosses rather than ticks that motivates me to find even more prospects.

I also have become very disciplined schedule-wise, as the years go by: in the morning I check my emails, and double check my replies very carefully, I then focus on new business development, which means booking new appointments and looking for new prospects; around 4pm I change my frame of mind and work on my proposals.

When it comes to working on my proposals I have learnt to personalize each one of them, I really take the time to tailor each proposal making sure that it’s perfect for each client: once I send the proposal by email I make a note in my agenda of when it was sent, and then mark a date for the follow-up (normally one week after the first email). I then follow up with a call or a second email, depending on the client’s availability. Once a proposal has been sent I follow that proposal like a hound and make sure I get a reply. Of course if the reply is positive great! If not then I need to ask questions as to why my offer was not agreeable and look to adapt the proposal in order to close the sale.

Being focused is vital, making sure you as an advertising sales person are effective each day. If you are disciplined, focused, you will never get distracted from the goal at hand.
